DOC.brief_title: Study Breast Tissue Women Not Previously Diagnosed With Breast Cancer Who Are Undergoing Fine Needle Aspiration
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - To determine breast tissue DNA methylation profile hormone concentration change across follicular luteal phase , across menopause , random fine needle aspiration sample woman prior diagnosis treatment breast cancer . - To determine DNA methylation profile breast hormone level correlate mammographic density , cytomorphology , Gail risk estimate . - To develop high throughput commercial assay DNA methylation profile assess breast cancer risk . - To develop highly sensitive , specific , novel nanoassay estradiol progesterone . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Premenopausal woman stratify menstrual cycle phase ( mid-follicular [ day 5-10 ] v mid-luteal [ day 20-25 ] ) , base adjust 28-day cycle . Patients undergo breast density measurement digital mammography . Blood sample obtain analyzed estradiol , progesterone , follicle-stimulating hormone measurement , define menstrual/menopausal status , DNA extraction . Patients also undergo random fine needle aspiration . Biopsy material aspiration analyze cytomorphology , steroid radioimmunoassay ( RIA ) , steroid nanoassay , DNA methylation study ( via polymerase chain reaction ) . The aspiration sample also analyze estradiol progesterone level use high-pressure liquid chromatography RIA .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Women meet one following requirement : Regularly cycle premenopausal woman 45 year age Perimenopausal woman 4555 year age â‰¥ two period past 6 month Postmenopausal woman 60 year age ( menstrual period 12 month folliclestimulating hormone ( FSH ) level > 25 IU/dL ) No history breast cancer diagnosis prior treatment breast cancer Negative breast evaluation within past 3 month PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : See Disease Characteristics PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : No concurrent oral contraceptive At least 2 week since prior aspirin , nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug , vitamin E
